context:
Create storage backend that uses GitHub Issues as task storage.

Requirements:
- Implement StorageEngine interface
- Use GitHub REST API via Octokit
- Map dex tasks to GitHub issues
- Support authentication via token
- Handle rate limiting gracefully

Mapping:
- id → issue.number (as string)
- description → issue.title  
- context → issue.body
- result → comment with ## Result header or body update
- status → issue.state + labels (dex:pending, dex:completed)
- priority → label (dex:priority-0, dex:priority-1, etc.)
- parent_id → sub-issues API (added Dec 2024)
- timestamps → issue created/updated/closed_at

Implementation approach:
1. Add @octokit/rest dependency
2. Create src/core/github-issues-storage.ts
3. Implement read() - fetch issues, parse to TaskStore
4. Implement write() - create/update/close issues
5. Handle authentication (token from env or config)
6. Add retry logic for rate limits

Done when:
- GitHubIssuesStorage class implements StorageEngine
- Can create/read/update/delete tasks via GitHub Issues
- Respects dex label prefix for filtering
- Authentication works with token
- Unit tests with mocked API calls
- Integration test with real GitHub (optional)

Related: GitHub Issues REST API, sub-issues support
Config: [storage.github-issues] owner, repo, token_env, label_prefix
